required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Endometrial Injury Prior Ovulation Induction for Assisted Reproductive Techniques: a Randomized Controlled Trial

collaborator.agency: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Científico e Tecnológico
Coordenação de Aperfeiçoamento de Pessoal de Nível Superior.

brief_summary.textblock: The objective of this study is to evaluate the effect of endometrial injury performed prior ovulation induction for assisted reproductive techniques main outcomes.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Stopped after safety analysis because of significant benefit of intervention.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.description: The complete expulsion or extraction from its mother of a product of fertilization, irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy, which, after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life, such as heart beat, umbilical cord pulsation, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, irrespective of whether the umbilical cord has been cut or the placenta is attached. Note: All allocated women will be used as denominator when assessing live birth rate.

secondary_outcome.description: Pregnancy diagnosed by ultrasonographic visualization of one or more gestational sacs or definitive clinical signs of pregnancy. It includes ectopic pregnancy. Multiple gestational sacs are counted as one clinical pregnancy. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing clinical pregnancy rate.
At least one fetus with heart beat after 12 weeks of gestational age. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing ongoing pregnancy rate.
Loss of a clinical pregnancy before 20 completed weeks of gestational age (18 weeks after fertilization). Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing miscarriage rate.
The number of gestational sacs observed divided by the number of embryos transferred.

The maximum distance perpendicular to the inter-endometrial interface from the endometrium-myometrium interface of the anterior to the posterior wall of the uterus assessed in the sagittal plane. This outcome will be assessed when at least one follicle ≥ 17mm is observed.
The total volume of endometrial tissue assessed by three-dimensional ultrasonography. This outcome will be assessed when at least one follicle ≥ 17mm is observed.

Vascularization index (VI), flow index (FI) and vascularization-flow index (VFI) assessed from endometrium using three-dimensional Power Doppler ultrasonography. This outcome will be assessed when at least one follicle ≥ 17mm is observed. Only VFI was reported as it is a combination of VI and FI (VFI = VI*FI/100), and currently there are several concerns about the validity of these indices. Such indices have no scale.

Pain will be assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). We will use a 10 cm length horizontal line, anchored by word descriptors at each end: "No Pain" = 0 cm and "Very Severe Pain" = 10 cm. This outcome will be assessed in both groups, just after endometrial injury or sham procedure.

arm_group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation.
Introduction of the speculum and wiping of the cervix with gaze for 30 seconds.

intervention.description: Evaluate the position and size of the uterus by transabdominal ultrasonography, with the bladder comfortably full. Identify the cervix with a disposable speculum. Open one sealed opaque envelope for allocation. Endometrial injury: Slide the Pipelle de Cornier® (Laboratoires Prodimed, Neully-En-Thelle, France) gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. Transbadominal ultrasound might be used to confirm position. Draw back the piston to the end of the biopsy cannula until it locks creating a negative pressure. Sweep the uterine fundus slowly several times up to the internal orifice of the cervix, using regular to-and-fro movements while rotating the sampler to include the whole uterine cavity in the specimen, for 30 seconds or until participant ask for stopping.
The investigator will dry the cervix with gauze and forceps for for 30 seconds or until participant ask for stopping.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women who will start assisted reproductive techniques with planned fresh embryo transfer.
- Age between 18 and 38 years.
- Written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:

overall_official.affiliation: Faculdade de Medicina de Ribeirão Preto, Universidade de São Paulo

facility.name: Setor de Reproducao Humana do HC-FMRP-USP

participant_flow.recruitment_details: The recruitment occurred from July 2010 to March 2012 in the fertility clinic of an university hospital.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All women that fulfilled eligibility criteria were invited to participate. Those who agreed were included. No women was excluded.

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Introduction of the speculum and wiping of the cervix with gaze for 30 seconds

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

group.description: Introduction of the speculum and wiping of the cervix with gaze for 30 seconds.

group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.description: The complete expulsion or extraction from its mother of a product of fertilization, irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy, which, after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life, such as heart beat, umbilical cord pulsation, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, irrespective of whether the umbilical cord has been cut or the placenta is attached. Note: All allocated women will be used as denominator when assessing live birth rate.

measure.title: Live Birth
measure.description: The complete expulsion or extraction from its mother of a product of fertilization, irrespective of the duration of the pregnancy, which, after such separation, breathes or shows any other evidence of life, such as heart beat, umbilical cord pulsation, or definite movement of voluntary muscles, irrespective of whether the umbilical cord has been cut or the placenta is attached. Note: All allocated women will be used as denominator when assessing live birth rate.

outcome.title: Clinical Pregnancy
outcome.description: Pregnancy diagnosed by ultrasonographic visualization of one or more gestational sacs or definitive clinical signs of pregnancy. It includes ectopic pregnancy. Multiple gestational sacs are counted as one clinical pregnancy. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing clinical pregnancy rate.

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

group.description: Introduction of the speculum and wiping of the cervix with gaze for 30 seconds.

measure.description: Pregnancy diagnosed by ultrasonographic visualization of one or more gestational sacs or definitive clinical signs of pregnancy. It includes ectopic pregnancy. Multiple gestational sacs are counted as one clinical pregnancy. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing clinical pregnancy rate.

outcome.title: Ongoing Pregnancy
outcome.description: At least one fetus with heart beat after 12 weeks of gestational age. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing ongoing pregnancy rate.

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

measure.title: Ongoing Pregnancy
measure.description: At least one fetus with heart beat after 12 weeks of gestational age. Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing ongoing pregnancy rate.

outcome.title: Miscarriage
outcome.description: Loss of a clinical pregnancy before 20 completed weeks of gestational age (18 weeks after fertilization). Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing miscarriage rate.
outcome.population: The number of clinical pregnancies was used as denominator, since miscarriage is a harm that can only happen in pregnant women.

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

group.title: Control Group
group.description: Introduction of the speculum and wiping of the cervix with gaze for 30 seconds.

measure.title: Miscarriage
measure.description: Loss of a clinical pregnancy before 20 completed weeks of gestational age (18 weeks after fertilization). Note: All allocated women will be considered when assessing miscarriage rate.
measure.population: The number of clinical pregnancies was used as denominator, since miscarriage is a harm that can only happen in pregnant women.

outcome.title: Implantation Rate
outcome.description: The number of gestational sacs observed divided by the number of embryos transferred.

outcome.title: Endometrial Thickness
outcome.description: The maximum distance perpendicular to the inter-endometrial interface from the endometrium-myometrium interface of the anterior to the posterior wall of the uterus assessed in the sagittal plane. This outcome will be assessed when at least one follicle ≥ 17mm is observed.
outcome.population: Women that achieved at least one follicle >17mm during ovarian stimulation.

group.title: Endometrial Injury Group
group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

outcome.title: Three-dimensional Doppler Indices From Endometrium (VFI)
outcome.description: Vascularization index (VI), flow index (FI) and vascularization-flow index (VFI) assessed from endometrium using three-dimensional Power Doppler ultrasonography. This outcome will be assessed when at least one follicle ≥ 17mm is observed. Only VFI was reported as it is a combination of VI and FI (VFI = VI*FI/100), and currently there are several concerns about the validity of these indices. Such indices have no scale.
outcome.population: Women that achieved at least one follicle >17mm during ovarian stimulation.

outcome.title: Procedure Related Pain
outcome.description: Pain will be assessed using a Visual Analogue Scale (VAS). We will use a 10 cm length horizontal line, anchored by word descriptors at each end: "No Pain" = 0 cm and "Very Severe Pain" = 10 cm. This outcome will be assessed in both groups, just after endometrial injury or sham procedure.

reported_events.desc: Major fetal malformation. The occurrence of major fetal malformation detected at birth was assessed by phone interview with the parents.

group.description: Endometrial biopsy was performed once with a pipelle de Cornier® in the month before initiating controlled ovarian stimulation. The pipelle was introduced gently through the cervix up to the uterine fundus. The piston was then drawn back to the end of the biopsy cannula until it self-locks and creates a negative pressure. Aiming to wound the entire endometrium, the examiner applied regular back-and-forth movements while rotating the sampler covering the whole uterine cavity. This procedure was continued until fragments of uterine mucosa appeared within the sheath, which generally took 30 seconds.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
